On 14-4-2016 at 0:48 AM, lude said:

dunno if this helps https://github.com/Crzyrndm/FilterExtension

None of KSPI-E custom sub categories works correctly with this version

28 minutes ago, FreeThinker said:

None of KSPI-E custom sub categories works correctly with this version

If you will read all this post what Crzy said you will undestend is noo real functional version release nether experimental, beta or what ever ....for 1.1 he only was try to work or make it work but short version is not functional

On 30.03.2016 at 7:38 AM, Crzyrndm said:

There will be no public releases of any of my mods until after 1.1 is actually released. There may be some github activity when I get around to working on things but any of that will all be at user risk. I'm not going to try supporting something that is listed as being "frequently updated" (still haven't decided whether I will bother with the pre-release at all...)

Post-release, I will be pushing hard to get updates out, just not before

 

On 12.04.2016 at 9:11 AM, Crzyrndm said:

I am, slowly (there's actually a 1.1 compile on Github, I just broke a few things to get that far). I'm definitely not not working on things because of difficulty or because of repeated builds, it's just constraints on my time currently are much tighter than I need to properly work on the mods I maintain

 

On 14.04.2016 at 9:07 AM, Crzyrndm said:

That was removed in the current commit (was me trying to track down some errors, wasn't meant to be committed). The problems are a lot more insidious than just some leftover logging, There are a rather large number of subcategories that should be showing up that aren't (because they're being removed because they have no parts which shouldn't be the case). I haven't yet had the time to track down the culprit(s)

Salute & Cya around

9 hours ago, FreeThinker said:

None of KSPI-E custom sub categories works correctly with this version

That would be because I've not published a working version until now.

Testing versions can be grabbed from Github if you're so inclined
Be aware you are using a development version that is not completely tested and still doesn't have any "new" features yet. If you see a subcategory that is not working as expected, I would appreciate a bug report (bug report requires a log, MM cache, subcat and category definitions, and a description of expected behaviour vs actual behaviour. Incomplete reports will be ignored)

Please log all reports to Github

Edited April 17, 2016 by Crzyrndm

I'd like to start using this in a test mode on 1.1, are you going to update Github soon with an updated build for the 1.1 release?

Things will be 1.1 compatible as soon as I am able to devote time to doing so (hopefully tonight, but...). Be patient, or it may end up at the bottom of the list
1.1 compatible release available on Github

Thank you a lot!

Also sorry, I just like to test stuff, even if it's unfinished :> should perhaps keep to the habit of not writing into threads when I do.

i assume i'm not the only one who took advantage of 64b to combine all their saves/installs into one, and had an overwhelming jumble of parts to sort through w/o this, and decided to just wait on actually building anything untill it was ready...

 

so with that said, time to get krakken!   err, i mean.  well you know what i mean!

thanks for the quick update

@Crzyrndm Thank you!.

I have been checking on your github for the last week and testing every change you made waiting for this release. Didn't seem like a straight forward task at all.

Anyways I have notice a bug and it appears the altitude control category is still missing. Anyone else confirming that?

Many thanks.

I get lost without this mod.  Really great stuff.

Cheers.

7 hours ago, merlinux said:

@Crzyrndm Thank you!.

I have been checking on your github for the last week and testing every change you made waiting for this release. Didn't seem like a straight forward task at all.

Anyways I have notice a bug and it appears the altitude control category is still missing. Anyone else confirming that?

The actual 1.1 update? Piece of cake. This mod interfaces so little with KSP in the first place, and neither interface changed. Only real updates was a few .cfg tweaks (and it looks like you may have found one I missed)

Fixing my half completed never tested pieces of work, re-factoring rubbish code and fixing logic issues from that? That's where all the time went

Edited April 22, 2016 by merlinux

Sorry to have to ask but struggling a little with simple config.

With the Procedural Parts mod, batteries don't get assigned to power storage category. I was trying to see how I would get this assigned but not sure. Only thing I've noticed is that the battery doesn't have the Electric Charge resource so guessing that's why its not assigned. 

Procedural Parts does have a config for Filter Extensions which mentions the battery but not sure what that's doing:

Spoiler

@PART[*]:HAS[@MODULE[ProceduralPart*]]:NEEDS[FilterExtension]
{
    @bulkheadProfiles ^= :$:,proc:
}

@PART[proceduralBattery]:NEEDS[FilterExtension]
{
    @bulkheadProfiles ^= :size0:size00:
}

Any suggestions please?

Edited April 22, 2016 by Torih

I'd like to suggest that heat controllers get their own sub-category, maybe in with aero tree?

 

Know they show up right there on the top of 'filter by module' section, but i always go looking for them under aero...
not trying to nit pick, but aren't they more utility than aero?... last time I checked they hate aerodynamic forces
this is true, but my brain always thinks of fiery re-entries when i think of heat, therefore~aero

Just to add on the pile, "Control" category is missing. There's some redundant tabs, too. I have 2 tabs in different sections for SpaceY.

Nitpickings aside, thanks a lot @Crzyrndm for this wonderful mod.

Edited April 22, 2016 by symmeclept

I haven't got all the configs updated for 1.1 yet, so there is the odd category not showing correctly or at all. I'm hoping to have checked all of them by the end of the weekend (some intermediary releases will be present also)

Edited April 22, 2016 by Crzyrndm

Filter Extension v2.4.3 is released

  • Fix equality checks breaking
  • Unpack dds icons and replace .pngs
  • Fixing config errors (please keep reporting these when you find them)
  • Removed testing category from distribution zip
  • "Stock rework" is now a part of the release once more

 

Edited April 22, 2016 by Crzyrndm

new information, me being a dummy

Hi,

as usual with every new update I'm back with new icons for my new set of mods. (This is something I do while I wait for all my mods to ctach with the new update: try new ones and update icons and some MM to my personal taste).

Expect a pull request soon. I've noticed that you now uses png AND dds files. Do you want me to convert icons to DDS?, if so..do you know some tool to make this for all at once? (it's rather annoying to do it one by one)

I believe there's some tool around that does it (I didn't do these myself, got given a zip a few months back that was sitting around waiting). If you want to stick to png that's fine by me, all icons are welcome
